result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on November 18, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.

Defendant Wali J Ali in court, in custody.  Attorney Guy Cardamone in court for Wali J Ali.  Attorney Cecila DeMarco in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Cardamone requests proffer. Atty DeMarco with response. State requests counts transactionally related. Atty Cardamone objects. State with argument. Atty Cardamone with argument. Atty DeMarco with response. Court finds that counts 1 and 2 are transactionally related. Witness G.G. sworn and testifies. Atty DeMarco with direct. Venue established. Defendant identified. Atty Cardamone with cross. Atty DeMarco with re-direct. Witness excused. Witness L.F. sworn and testifies. Atty DeMarco with direct. Atty Cardamone with cross. Atty DeMarco with re-direct. Witness excused. Motions made by state. Atty Cardamone with argument. Atty DeMarco with rebuttal. Court makes findings of probable cause.

8:36 AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant Wali J Ali in court.  Attorney Crystal Vera appeared for defendant. Attorney Annie Jay  in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Vera states formal appointment of counsel is coming. Requests to waive time limits and set for a preliminary. No objection from State. Court will grant and sets for preliminary.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:49 PM Defendant Wali J Ali in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Frank Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE is eligible for SPD, no appt yet.  DE wants to waive for counsel.   CT find good cause to set over.
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

2:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Wali J Ali in court, in custody.  Attorney Tracey J Lencioni in court for Wali J Ali. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
